metadata.Title: CVE-2018-5142 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
If Media Capture and Streams API permission is requested from documents with "data:" or "blob:" URLs, the permission notifications do not properly display the originating domain. The notification states "Unknown protocol" as the requestee, leading to user confusion about which site is asking for this permission. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 59.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5142` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 59.0+build5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 59.0+build5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 59.0+build5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 59.0+build5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '59.0+build5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
